availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Lewis W. Garth (Todd Co, Ky, farmer and prov govt)

body.p: Todd County, Kentucky, farmer and provisional government convention member. Virginia native. Married to Lucy T. Cross Garth in Todd County, Kentucky, on November 28, 1846. Father of Elizabeth Garth, William T. Garth, Hortense M. Garth, and Kate D. Garth. Farmer n Todd County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Farmer in Todd County in 1860. Owned fifty-seven enslaved persons in Todd County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provision government held at Russellville in November 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District No. 1, p. 219A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, District 1.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, p. 361B-362A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Todd County, Trenton, p. 466B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Todd County Marriages, Film #000367186.
KYR-0004-033-0001.
